result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray A. Munoz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: MAY PETITION THE COURT AFTER 12 MONTHS IF ALL CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MET
$50 PER MONTH COMMENCING JULY 5, 2015. ADVISED $15 PAYMENT PLAN FEE

MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Ray A. Munoz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. background of case. Defendant wishes to accept offer. Plea questionnaire completed. D.A. stated agreement. Plea to Count 1  . Court finds plea freely given. Defendant enter guilty plea to paraphernalia. Court questioned defendant on plea questionnaire & rights. 
Court finds defendant guilty factual basis on complaint. 
Court: Sentenced to 3 days in Marquette County Jail with 3 days credit. Time served. $442.00 fine & costs. Provide DNA sample & pay $200 surcharge. AODA assessment & follow up treatment. May petition Court for expungement under 973     $50 per month. Advised $15 payment plan fee

Defendant Ray A. Munoz in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature; no special conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  
Court questions the defendant.

  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  
Set for Return.
  Return date scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
